comments:
Build ID: I20070209-1006

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Create path entry variable with CDT 4.0M5
2. Install recent CDT build 
3. Search For pathentry variable added before


More information:
Also if pathentry variable used in standard make c++ project include paths as external include path (not from workspace) it is converted to workspace include path
before convesion was: ${Solution}/Include
after conversion is /ProjectName/${Solution}/Include
My bad.. going to fix ASAP..

This should be fixed now.. Please verify..

Mikhail

Now got today build from CVS HEAD and tried to open C/C++ Project View got exception "Unable to create view ID org.eclipse.cdt.ui.CView: An unexpected exception was thrown.", which stack pasted below.
Also looked at C/C++ build variables in project proeprties and my workspaces defined variables does not show up here as in previuos build, but they exists in workspace CDT prefernces in CDT build variables.

(In reply to comment #3)
Ok, I see the problem. I've a fix locally. I'll test it and commit it soon.

Thanks,
Mikhail

Done.. (In reply to comment #3)

> Also looked at C/C++ build variables in project proeprties and my workspaces
> defined variables does not show up here as in previuos build, but they exists
> in workspace CDT prefernces in CDT build variables. 
The workspace-level variables are treatted as "system" on the project level. Try selecting the "Show System Variables" check-box of the project "C/C++ Variables" page. They should be there..

Regards,
Mikhail
